headline: Best Turkey Meatloaf
description: Turkey meatloaf gets tons of flavor and a tender texture from onion, garlic, buttery cracker crumbs, and a super-tasty ketchup‚Äìbrown sugar glaze.
name: Best Turkey Meatloaf

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a jelly-roll pan.
Mix ground turkey, crushed crackers, milk, onion, egg, garlic, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. Shape mixture into a loaf and place on the prepared pan.
Mix ketchup, brown sugar, and Worcestershire sauce in a separate bowl; set aside.
Bake meatloaf in preheated oven for 30 minutes; remove from the oven and drain off liquids. Top meatloaf with ketchup topping.

Return loaf to the oven and continue baking until no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes more; an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I used Italian bread crumbs. Meatloaf is very moist and tasty.
I used bread crumbs instead of crushed crackers. Taste good to me.

I very rarely review recipes, but wow, this was delicious! I was skeptical because when I make my ground beef meatloaf I add a lot of different seasonings. I made this recipe exactly as written. It was amazing. I would not change anything about it or add anything to it. My son-in-law loved it and he‚Äôs hard to please. Thank you for sharing. This is going into the weekly rotation.
This was very tasty and by far my husband's favorite meatloaf recipe hands down!!

As I don't eat Red meat, I use ground Turkey for meatballs (bake in cupcake pans) and Meatloaf. I always add half pound ground pork so Turkey will not be dry or/and half pound chorizo. I use bread crumbs or stuffing mix. An egg. NO milk. A little bbq sauce, sauteed peppers, onions, big fan of Garlic. Don't like bland food so I season "heavy handed". Lol.

Not a ground turkey lover but wanted to try anyway. I added a little bit of fresh celery, and used Ritz crackers‚Ä¶I alway put two strips of bacon on any meatloaf.. This was delicious and would definitely make it again. Since I cook for me, I sliced and put some in the freezer.

This recipe is GREAT! I didn‚Äôt have crackers so I used bread crumbs. I didn‚Äôt have Worcestershire sauce so I googled a recipe and made it to add to the topper. It was great and my family loved it! I will continue to use this recipe.

The recipe was good although I needed a bigger portion and only had some ground beef to add (which you would obviously not do) I also added green peppers and a package of onion soup mix. The glaze on top was delicious. The kids didn't hesitate to get seconds.
I loved this meatloaf! I‚Äôve made it three times and it‚Äôs always perfect!
I make this probably about every other month. I add celery to the mixture along with garlic salt. The topping makes this flavorful which I put on about the last ten minutes of cooking. Very good.
Good! Didn't change it much, just incorporated some ketchup& ketchup mix in to the dish before cooking. No sugar either. Ketchup has plenty. Other crackers can be used
Perfect!

The first time I'm trying this recipe and it turned out great I added more because I was doing more for the kid's I didn't use the onions because I'm allergic to those but everything was great it turned out wonderful Thanks will be trying it again
This recipe has become a family fav! Flavorful. Moist. Addictive. You forget it‚Äôs turkey!

Yum! My teenage boys dig into this with just as much gusto as a beef meatloaf. I don't use the crushed crackers; I prefer seasoned bread crumb. I double the recipe and use 3lbs. of ground turkey. I have very little left over. üòÅ
Definitely will make this again üòâ
It was really good. I expected more juices to drain after 30 min. of baking but there was very little if any. It was tangy and full of flavor.
Can't stress enough how good this came out. The only thing I added was an 8oz can of tomatoe sauce. But this turned out to be truly, the best meatload (turkey or otherwise) I've ever had.
I‚Äôm a beginner cook. This was easy and tasted great! I learned to mince garlic too.

Made this last night and the WHOLE family chowed down and loved it! The only addition I made was to add some chopped portabella mushrooms, just to sneak them in without my kids noticing ;) I also didn't do the glaze just because we aren't big fans of too much "sweetness" on top, but we served it with a dollop of ketchup for the kids to dip in. Delicious and we will definitely make this again!
My husband and I love this turkey meatloaf. I usually add more crackers to reduce the liquid portion. I love the fact it's made with turkey instead of ground beef.
Too sweet, I would sub tomato paste for ketchup & maybe add alittle basalmic to the glaze.
Very flavorful and not bland tasting like some turkey meatloaf recipes. This is a keeper!
This recipe was so delicious and moist!

This is so simple. First: I made the original recipe and it‚Äôs good. But I‚Äôm lazy if I‚Äôm not cooking for company. My domestic partner will just chow down what I set before him. Lol. Actually lazy version is just as good if not better. No crackers. Use stuffing mix (not cubed). It adds herbs ie flavor. Ground Turkey or chicken is bland. I used plain almond milk. No one knows. Please don‚Äôt add salt. Plenty in stuffing mix. No brown sugar? Who keeps brown sugar if not a baker? You don‚Äôt need it. But if you want the sweetness then make your own. It‚Äôs 2-3 tablespoons of molasses to one cup white sugar. Who has molasses? Much preferable for pancakes than store bought syrup. Unless maple. Maple syrup is so good. But I digress. That should do it. Good luck!
Loved this recipe only thing that I changed was instead of crackers I substituted "Stove Top Turkey flavoured staffing". "It taste like Thanksgiving" said by my 11 year old daughter Scarlett.

I was pleasantly surprised. I don't think I'll ever use beef again for meatloaf. I did substitute stove top herb stuffing, because I was using this as a cheaper alternative to whole turkey for Thanksgiving. My husband loved it and it's not easy to please him. I highly recommend this recipe. The herb dressing was subtle, so it could be used anytime.
I love this recipe. I make it gluten free and add some shredded carrots and green pepper. My advise is to double the sauce though as everyone loves it!
Yes I made it and will make it again and this time I changed the buttery biscuits to a lovely quality of plain corn chips crushed up.
It was one of the best meatloafs that I have made, it was the first time not using breadcrumbs and I love the topping
Absolutely delicious! Even the kids loved it. Super moist and tasty.

This will now be my Turkey Meatloaf recipe! It was nice a firm, not mushy, delicious! 
Thank you!
Love this recipe, however, I don‚Äôt think the milk is necessary. I skip it everytime and it‚Äôs still plenty moist and perfect.
Very easy and delicious. It held it‚Äôs shape well, using 85% lean turkey, with no crumbling. I doubled everything for two loaves.

This was my first time making a meatloaf and it was delicious! The recipe was simple to follow. I made a few alterations to mine by using a table spoon of onion powder and 1/2 table spoon of creole seasoning. I also used stuffing finely mashed since I did not have crackers. Instead of ketchup we had gravy. I will definitely be making this one again. Thank you!
Very easy recipe. Only replaced egg, daughter is allergic. Will make again.

Deliciously moist and flavorful! I only changed a couple of things. Cut the salt in half and instead of 1/2 cup ketchup for the sauce, I substituted 1/4 cup Sweet Baby Rays No Sugar added BBQ sauce and 1/4 cup ketchup. No brown sugar at all and still used the Worcestershire sauce. YUMMY! We have a new family favorite for family dinners!!!

Be sure to add a red meat to the turkey to make it savory. We used ground lamb, ground chuck would work too. . Grill the onions with a bit of garlic. Cut the brown sugar by 1/2. Tips to drain halfway through before adding topping worked well. I‚Äôd make this again.

I had to substitute the brown sugar in the topping, used white sugar but used 1 tbs less and added 1/2 tsp rice vinegar and a pinch of salt. Also I used gluten free breadcrumbs instead of the crackers.
Came out just fine, thank you.

Absolutely perfect! The best Turkey meatloaf I‚Äôve ever had. The flavor was great, the texture was perfect. I can‚Äôt say enough about it! I sprinkled Tabasco on one slice and the combination of the heat with the sweetness of the topping was even better! My husband, 8 yr old, and 3 yr old ALL cleaned their plates, and that never happens!
My son already snagged a few pieces. Sweeter than I thought it would be.

I‚Äôve made this recipe twice. It‚Äôs very good! Make sure to use regular ground turkey instead of ground turkey breast , which is way too dry. I subbed onion powder for the fresh onion because I‚Äôm not fond of the texture of fresh onion in meatloaf. For the glaze I used my old stand-by: 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 TBSP brown sugar, and 1 tsp dry mustard powder. Delicious!
I used garlic powder instead of fresh garlic. It was easy to make and very tasty.
Great recipe, hits the spot in comfort food.

This was really good and moist. 
I think the crackers were a good touch.
I will make it again.

We really enjoyed this! The glaze gives it great flavor-absolutely delicious! I always use ground turkey breast & in addition to the other ingredients added one tbsp. of diced green chilies. It gives a nice boost in flavor. I usually just buy a small can of mild chopped green chilies, drain the liquid, & freeze what is left in a ziplock baggie for for future use.

We love it! 3rd time I've made it. only changes were: I added some chopped shrooms and grated parmesan to the mix and substituted Progresso Italian (I'm from old school Italian NY, cut me a break!) breadcrumbs. I've been making it in a 4 mini loaf pan but husband made it to the plate and ate one before I could get my photo op.
Excellent! Better than any hamburger meatloaf I've ever had.

Great recipe that the family loved!! Very moist and flavorful. I didn‚Äôt have any butter crackers on hand, so I used panco bread crumbs toasted in a small pan with 2 TBSP butter. I also substituted the garlic cloves for 1 tsp garlic powder. I used a pan that makes 4 mini loves, so the total cooking time was only 30 minutes. I made extra sauce to serve on the side. So delicious!
Held together well super juicy and delicious!

Best recipe, easy to make. Only changes made; I used Italian Style bread crumbs.
Entire family loved it. Can you tell by my picture.
Many thanks
DPoll - Houston
hard as a rock, not at all juicy. inedible.

I wanted to try a new turkey meatloaf recipe and really wanted something more flavorful, since ground turkey can tend to be a bit bland. This was super flavorful and nice and moist. This is my new favorite turkey meatloaf! Try it, you will love it.
I made exactly as written (in a toaster oven no less) and it turned out amazingly. Very impressed with how great such a simple meatloaf can taste. This is replacing my old go to recipe .

I made it as is. The only thing I changed I used season salt vs salt. It was very good. I really loved the sauce. 1 out of 2 of my picky eaters enjoyed it. But besides the kids my husband and I loved it. Would definitely make this again. I also used a loaf pan.

This has become my meatloaf recipe for all I have used it with ground chicken and ground beef. It is absolutely the best meatloaf recipe. My nephew who normally doesn't like meatloaf couldn't stop raving about it he loved it! It has become a favorite meal and if there are any leftovers which is rare, it makes for awesome meatloaf sandwiches the next day if it makes it that long usually I wake the next morning to an empty dish. Thank you for the recipe.
My husband and I love this meatloaf. I have made it many times. The only way I ever vary the recipe is to add small chunks of cheddar in the mixture once in a while
I added chopped chopped mushrooms and red bell pepper. I didn't have crackers, so I used bread crumbs instead. It was very tasty

I made this recipe exactly as posted and also with alterations. It‚Äôs a good recipe but since I have 2 young adult sons and a husband who eat a lot, I changed a couple things. I used two full 20 ounce packages of ground turkey. Instead of crushed crackers I used about a cup of Italian bread crumbs, threw in some extra garlic and came up with a good sized meatloaf that tasted great. I think it‚Äôs delicious and you can add or subtract ingredients to suit your taste.
Was delicous!!

Sorry but this was a flop. I agree with some of the other reviews. Milk made it sloppy wet. No flavor. I'm no stranger to Worcestershire and Ketchup but it takes almost a 1:1 ratio to give it the effect taste. I use it for steak sauce at home a lot. this was overly sweet, not a lot else going on. Sorry, I like savory maincourses. We will make due with left overs I think I can salvage something else out of it but this was disappointing.

made this the other day after searching for a heart healthy meatloaf alternative. Cut out the salt altogether and used panko instead of the cracker and only the egg white, almond milk and adjusted where needed for 2 lbs of the turkey. Instead of the original toping (again to avoid the salt) I used a Carolina BBQ sauce. It came out very moist and not much in the way of extra juices in the pan when cooking.

I made this exactly as described. The verdict is in: the topping is great, but the meat loaf itself is bland. I'm not going to make it again and start doctoring it; I'd rather look around for a better recipe!

This was delicious! I didn't have onions so i put in a tsp and a half of onion powder. Due to acid reflux and psoriasis we stay away from red sauces, I used brown gravy. I have two VERY picky eaters. There were no complaints and amazingly(and sadly) no left overs. Gonna have to make a bigger batch next time. Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe!
If you are wanting to do a turkey version vs beef this is really pretty good. It is very moist and the sauce is delicious.

I hadn't made turkey meatloaf in years, since it wasn't a family favorite. My mom-in-law was visiting, so I decided to make one of her favorites dishes. The entire family loved it. The only change - I only used two tablespoons of milk and added 1/2 cup of Valida Onion Salad dressing. Moist and flavorful.
Delicious! Very moist and the sauce is amazing !
Seriously. This is the best recipe for a turkey meatloaf. The only recipe I use now. Also, double the sauce. Everyone wants more sauce!!

This was exceptional! I made this to feed to my family last night who refuse veggies and anything healthy. I made it mostly as the recipe stated however I didn't have all the exact ingredients. I did add minced veggies to this to try and pull a fast one on my kids and it worked! Bonus: I minced onions, 2 slices of bacon, handfull of mushrooms, fresh spinach, fresh kale and cooked those down in a sauce pan with a little EVOO. I then combined everything together like the recipe calls for. I omitted all the sugar and added the worcestershire to the meat mix instead and topped with ketchup only the last 30 min. This recipe came out amazing and my super picky kids asked for seconds!!!
Very good. Reduced milk by half. Added a couple splashes of Worcestershire sauce. Will make again.

I never thought I'd like turkeyloaf more than meatloaf, but this recipe proved me wrong! My wife and I LOVE it. I even made meatballs for spaghetti using this exact recipie!
It's a keeper!

I made this once and they ate it all up. This time I doubled the recipe. I added more seasoning than the recipe calls for, parsley, paprika this time. I would replace crackers and milk with mashed potatoes to make it healthier.
Thanks for this quick easy yummy recipe!!
After all the meatloaf recipes I have tried over the years, this one actually got a high five... I mean meatloaf really isn't that complicated. But this one seemed to make everyone happy.

This is a great recipe. I have shared this recipe with many people who ate it at my home and loved it.

I saute the onion before adding it.
 
Besides the garlic cloves I add some garlic powder...it mixes into the ingredients more uniformly than just the cloves.

Very good and moist! I did make some modifications. I didn‚Äôt add salt or brown sugar, because husband is diabetic. I did mix ketchup, Worcestershire and some bbq sauce together for the mixture. Added some celery.
My family and I loved this recipe!
My family and I loved this recipe!
Very good!!Super easy.
it was very moist and the taste was good. Next time I might put a little more seasoning
No changes made to the recipe and definitely will make it again. Was really yummy!! Best turkey meatloaf ever.
Family favorite! We make it every Monday night! We only cook it for 40 minutes tho.. it dries out after that.. def use a meat thermometer
No changes to the recipe.

I made 2 changes to fit my tastes. I did not add milk (and there was no liquid to remove) and I added 1/2 of a red pepper, chopped. I baked for 30 mins, left it on the stove top for 2 hours then added the sauce and baked another 30 mins. I did not cover with foil either time. I doubled the recipe so I could freeze 1/2 of it for a later meal. VERY GOOD!
Excellent!! will make it again. Thank you!

Everyone loved it!! I had two lbs of ground turkey, used lipton garlic & herb soup mix instead of salt + pepper, added some red pepper flakes and 1-2 tablespoons of dijon mustard after reading some other reviews. I also used no sugar ketchup and stevia brown sugar mix for the sauce.
I didn‚Äôt have buttery crackers so I substituted seasoned breadcrumbs. Next time, I‚Äôll use less brown sugar. Overall - this is an awesome recipe.
Only used 1 lb of turkey but otherwise followed recipe. Outstanding! Moist, flavorful and topping is excellent.
I used plain breadcrumbs instead of crackers. It's what I had on hand. I think it was still good.
My go-to recipe.

It turned out really well. Are used 3 pounds of turkeys so doubled all of the ingredients, and was pleasantly surprised by the consistency of this meatloaf. It was not mushy whatsoever, it was delicious. Although, I might use a little less garlic next time.
The sauce really makes it
I used seasoned Texas toast croutons instead of crackers, added chopped up carrots, celery and garlic powder. Then half marinara sauce, half ketchup for the topping and it was soooo good!
used 1 c bread crumbs and reduced milk to 1/4 cup. Tasted Fantastic!

Added my twist on the putting in fresh parsley and crushed red peppers for a kick. Used minced onions since i desperately dislike cutting up fresh onions Tried out a bottle of Turkey Seasoning kept the glaze stayed as is. It came out surprisingly MOIST! I have saved this recipe for another day, will try with beef or pork also. It was definitely delicious.
To get small children to devour it- omit the onions. This recipe satisfies the pickiest of toddlers

So good! I used 1lb turkey & whole wheat ritz. I didn‚Äôt use egg or milk, but added Italian seasoning, ground coriander, smoke paprika, and a bbq seasoning from the farmers market to the turkey mix. I added a dollop of Dijon mustard and a couple shakes of my favorite hot sauce to the sauce. I paired it with a green bean casserole and it was a big hit! This was the best meatloaf I‚Äôve ever made for sure my husband wolfed it down.
Excellent tasty meatloaf! I didn‚Äôt have the crackers but I added a cup of chipotle breadcrumbs

We tried this for the first time, it was addictive, both hot & cold. My children ages 21 - 46 years loved it to the point we made another batch. We divided it into 6 small aluminum pans, hoping to freeze a couple for later on, but that never happened.
I made turkey meatloaf for the first time My family loved it. I did not change a thing. This receive all thumbs up.
